headline: AES potential sale, WPP outlook, copper miners: Trending Tickers
summary: AES (AES) is jumping after Bloomberg reported the renewable energy provider, which powers artificial (AI) data centers, is exploring a potential sale. WPP (WPP) is sinking after the ad giant cut its full-year revenue outlook, now expecting a 3–5% sales decline amid weak consumer spending and shifting marketing trends. Copper (HG=F) mining stocks, like Freeport-McMoRan (FCX) and Southern Copper (SCCO), are volatile after President Trump floated a potential 50% tariff on copper. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts here.

headline: Stocks to Watch Wednesday: Freeport-McMoRan, AES, Merck, Fair Isaac
summary: ↘️ Freeport-McMoRan (FCX): The miner's shares fell, partly paring Tuesday's gains that came after President Trump said he would impose 50% tariffs on copper. Shares of overseas copper producers such as️ Glencore (UK:GLEN) and Anglo American (UK:AAL) declined Wednesday.

headline: Dow Jones Futures Rise Amid Trump Tariff News; Elon Musk Tells Tesla Bull To 'Shut Up'
summary: The major indexes were quiet, while copper prices spiked on Trump tariffs. Some leaders struggled, but AMD and some other AI plays thrived. Elon Musk told a longtime Tesla bull to "shut up."

headline: Amex Exploration Appoints Two New Directors to Drive Strategic Focus on Perron Gold Project Development
summary: Montreal, Quebec--(Newsfile Corp. - July 9, 2025) - Amex Exploration Inc. (TSXV: AMX) (FSE: MX0) (OTCQX: AMXEF) ("Amex" or the "Company") announces the appointment of Phil Brumit and Peter Damouni to its Board of Directors, following the Company's Annual General and Special Meeting held on June 30, 2025. headline: U.S. Copper Surges, London Prices Fall. How Trump’s Tariff Is Roiling the Market.
summary: President Donald Trump’s 50% tariff on imports of the metal sent U.S prices higher while London prices sank.  U.S.-listed copper miners were set for further gains, with Freeport-McMoRan up 2.4% in premarket trading and Southern Copper gaining 1%.  “The key end markets for copper-containing products in the U.S. are construction, electronics, and transportation, suggesting quite a broad-based impact of the tariffs,” wrote Julius Baer’s Carsten Menke in a research note.
